document.discussion_title: U.S. swim team co-captains Nathan Adrian, Anthony Ervin move into 50m freestyle semifinals | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: U.S. swim team co-captains Nathan Adrian, Anthony Ervin move into 50m freestyle semifinals Adrian, Ervin into 50m free semis NBC Olympics.com Published: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) Nathan Adrian, fresh off his bronze medal-winning 100m freestyle Wednesday night, advanced from the qualifying heats of the 50m freestyle into the semifinals on Thursday afternoon alongside fellow U.S. swim team co-captain Anthony Ervin. Adrian and Ervin raced the same heat and finished first and second, separated by 0.02 of a second. Defending 2012 Olympic champion Florent Manaudou of France also advanced in fourth place, with a time of 21.72 seconds. Australian Cam McEvoy, Canada’s Santo Condorelli and Vladimir Morozov of Russia also advanced to the final. Share this:

Adrian and Ervin raced the same heat and finished first and second, separated by 0.02 of a second. Defending 2012 Olympic champion Florent Manaudou of France also advanced in fourth place, with a time of 21.72 seconds.
